Class Reference

java.lang.Object
  Reference

public class Reference
extends java.lang.Object

Serves two purposes. Can either be a reference to a node (i.e., its parent node and a pointer index within that parent node), or to a search key value in a leaf node (i.e., the leaf node and the key index within that leaf node).

Constructor Summary
Reference(Node p, int i, boolean m)
          Constructs a Reference object and initializes the fields with the parameters.

          Decrease the index value.

          Returns the match value of this reference.

Constructor Detail

Reference

public Reference(Node p,
                 int i,
                 boolean m)
Constructs a Reference object and initializes the fields with the parameters.

Parameters:
p - the node it refers
i - the index of the key (pointer) it refers to
m - for the result of search, true if the key matchs the search value
Method Detail

getNode

public Node getNode()
Returns the Node which this reference refers to.

Returns:
A node object this reference refers to.

getIndex

public int getIndex()
Get the index

Returns:
the index

getMatch

public boolean getMatch()
Returns the match value of this reference. The match field is used only for returning a search result If the key value this reference refers to matches the search value, match is set to true, otherwise it is set to false.

Returns:
the match value

increaseIndex

public void increaseIndex()
Increase the index value. Used when a search key moves within a node.

decreaseIndex

public void decreaseIndex()
Decrease the index value. Used when a search key moves within a node.
